Please visit PLuS Alliance website for more information."}],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"YMED5010 - GIS and Analysis","description":"

Geographic Information Systems technology continues to play a key role in public administration and governmental operations related to the provision of public service, governmental decision-making, policy analysis and public program evaluation. This course will provide foundational information related to the application of Geographic Information Systems (GIS) technology to meet the various needs within governmental operations and public administration.


The first half of the semester will focus on developing skills within the various GIS tools while building upon philosophical and theoretical foundations of Geospatial Information Sciences used to model and analyze real world conditions. The second half of the semester will focus on each student’s specific area of interests through an independent research project utilizing GIS technology to address public sector issues. With the continually broadening scope of applications for which GIS technology can be applied, the opportunities are boundless with respect to the various projects that can be undertaken to improve governmental operations, the provision of public services, policy analysis, and program evaluation.


This courses will be taught by Arizona State University as part of the PluS Alliance. The course will be taught fully online.

This course offers an overview of the field of health informatics, with particular emphasis in clinical informatics. It combines perspectives from medicine and computer science for use of computers and information in healthcare and the health sciences. The course covers applications and general methodology in health informatics using current topics in the field.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"d592a0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619fb","name":"Fully online - "},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Final exam","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"40","description":"

The final exam will examine content of the lectures and readings. 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"5192a0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619fc","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"5192a0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619fd","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"5192a0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619fe","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"5992a0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619fc","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"5992a0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619fd","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"5192e0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f396190c","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Papers","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"45","description":"

Students will be required to submit three papers in the course. 

Paper 1: Answer questions 2 and 3 from Chapter 3 “Biomedical Decision Making: Probabilistic Clinical Reasoning” from Shortliffe et al. book.

Paper 2: Answer questions 4 and 5 from Chapter 17 “Consumer Health Informatics and Personal Health Records” from Shortliffe et al. book.

Paper 3: Answer questions 4 and 5 from Chapter 4 “Cognitive Science and Biomedical Informatics” from Shortliffe et al. book.

Each paper is worth 15% (3 x 15% = 45% total). Papers are to be 4 pages (1000 words), Times New Roman 12, double space, 1 inch margins

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"5192a0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619fc","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"5192a0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619fd","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"5192a0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619fe","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"5992a0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619fc","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"5992a0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619fd","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"d592a0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619ff","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Discussion board participation","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"15","description":"

The student is expected to read the weekly reading material or other assigned material and provide well-informed answers to the provided questions for discussion. There are three discussions comprising an initial post and a response post which students must participate in. The student is expected to answer each posted question with at least 2 paragraphs (equivalently, at least 7 sentences in total for each response).

Each discussion is worth 5% (3 x 5% = 15% total).

This course will give students a thorough coverage of the foundations of Database Systems and their specific use and modeling in healthcare and biomedical environments. Students will learn through hands-on experience with the modeling and implementation of health-related databases using the relational approach. Topics include an overview of database models and architecture, database design, SQL, XML, and data warehousing as they are applied in clinical domains.  Students will also be encouraged to explore database-related topics of their own choosing that are relevant to a bioinformatics or clinical domain.

Doctorate.","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Postgraduate","value":"pgrd"},"code":"YMED9130","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"YMED9130 - Pharmaceutical Global Regulatory Affairs Leadership","description":"

This course is designed to provide participants with the skills, knowledge and global networks to discuss and develop strategies to address principles and issues facing global pharmaceutical regulatory affairs and its role in the maintenance of public health. Participants will develop a deep understanding of therapeutic product regulation across the world and acquire the skills and self-knowledge to lead change management in international regulatory issues. It is designed for people who are currently working in pharmaceutical regulatory affairs and wanting to move into senior global management positions in regulatory affairs.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"9a92e0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619de","name":"Fully online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly) - ASU"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Individual essay","assessment_type":{"label":"Essay","value":"essay"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"25","description":"

Participants will write an essay comparing and contrasting two regulatory jurisdictions with respect to one of the frameworks (eg, transparency, harmonisation, early access, etc) discussed in the course. They should provide their considered opinion on ways these frameworks are implemented in each system and future opportunities for further development. They will receive individual feedback via GradeMark.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"5292e0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619e0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"5a92e0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619e0","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"5292e0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619e9","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Collaborative Strategy Report","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"40","description":"

Participants will work in groups to formulate an appropriate global strategy for the registration of a hypothetical therapeutic product (30%). They will be expected to review the contribution of their group members as well as peer review the final projects of other groups in the class (10%). They will be provided with marking rubrics and will receive written feedback.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"5292e0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619e0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"5292e0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619e1","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"5a92e0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619e1","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"5a92e0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619ec","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Discussion Forums","assessment_type":{"label":"Tutorial work","value":"tutorial_work"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"15","description":"

Participants are expected to actively participate in the Discussion Forums focused on each Section of the course. They will be evaluated on the originality of their contributions, their ability to generate further discussion on the topic and their professional attitude. They will be required to submit their top 3 posts plus a 200-word justification as to why they have chosen these are their best posts. They will be given a marking rubric and will receive feedback against the rubric through GradeMark.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"5292e0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619e0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"5a92e0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619e0","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"d692e0d0dbbdfc90be4672f5f39619e5","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Personal Leadership Development Plan","assessment_type":{"label":"Portfolio","value":"portfolio"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"20","description":"

Participants will be expected to keep a personal reflective journal detailing their thought processes and personal learning over the duration of the course and use this to construct a Personal Development Plan. The personal development plan will be submitted at the end of the course.  Participants will be provided with a marking rubric and examples of reflective practice and receive feedback via GradeMark.
